newsitem.title: USA: IVAX to countersue Bergen Brunswig.
newsitem.headline: IVAX to countersue Bergen Brunswig.

text.p: IVAX Corp said Friday it would file a lawsuit against Bergen Brunswig Corp, which already has sued IVAX, charging it with breach of agreement in connection with the termination of their merger deal.

Bergen Brunswig on March 20 called off a previously announced $1.6 billion merger agreement with IVAX and filed a suit against the Miami holding company of health-care product subsidiaries in U.S. District Court in New York last Friday.

But in a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, IVAX said Friday that it does not believe the Orange, Calif.-based drug wholesaler had a legal right to end their merger pact and "intends to defend the suit vigorously and pursue a counterclaim for breach of agreement" by Bergen Brunswig.
IVAX said Friday that it has a stake of 12,157,432 Class A common shares of Bergen Brunswig, or 24.3 percent of the total.

But in its orginal filing on Bergen Brunswig in November, IVAX reported that its stake consisted of an option from Bergen Brunswig to buy up to 9,953,076 shares and a voting agreement with Bergen Brunswig Chief Executive Officer Robert Martini, who represented that he then owned 2,137,958 shares.
Lisa Riordan, director of investor relations at Bergen Brunswig, said her company was unaware of any stake held by IVAX in Bergen Brunswig besides the option.
"We're not aware of any investment in our company by IVAX," Riordan said.
